text.tspan: Realizing that Jake possessed exceptional leadership qualities, Nagano decided that it would be more
advantageous for him to fight under Jake's command than for him to fight against the Wolf Gang as two
separate groups of equals, so he decided to take a group of his men and joined Jake's group. To Jake, who
had built his organization from scratch in a bunker, and General Nagano, who is hardened by battle-honed
combat experience, the Wolf Gang was nothing more than a ragtag group of thugs. Falsely feigning
submission to the Wolf gang, Nagano and his followers quickly took control of the people and set up shop,
only to turn against them as soon as they were ready. Although the Wolf Gang had control of the facilities,
supplies, and ample weapons, they were no match for Jake, who knew their situation like the back of his
hand and had a plan in place. In the end, they were stripped of their weapons, supplies, and even their
lives. Jake and his followers were welcomed by the local population as liberators.
The citizens of Old Texas wanted Jake to be their new leader. Embracing his role as a
leader, Jake rebuilt the refinery that the Wolf Gang had used so poorly, making it more
efficient at producing oil. He also revitalized many of the ravaged farms to boost the food
supply. Weapons and vehicles were overhauled to keep outlaws from raiding and
protecting the people, and specialized personnel were selected to identify and utilize
available pre-war equipment and facilities, laying the foundation for fundamental
Although he was not an expert in any singular field, Jake's judgment, determination, and
charisma were more than enough to get those under his command to follow his instructions
willingly. What was once a tiny village controlled by the Wolf Gang had grown into a small
city, completed with housing, food production areas, and a marketplace. Jake named the
city Fidelia after the opera Fidelio, which he listened to as a boy growing up in the bunker.
He envisioned Fidelia as an idealized version of the opera's beautifully melodic and
harmonious score, where no one was in charge, and everyone was in harmony.
When Jake drove the Wolf Gangs out, their territory covered about 150 square kilometers, with people living in
the area they controlled. Naturally, the provisional territory of early Fidelia was also defined by the
approximate boundaries of that area. In addition, during the time of the Wolf Gang's dominance, there were
men under their command who were in charge of the different regions. Jake chose to retain a few of them as
local representatives rather than expel them to facilitate his initial city management, which recognized the fact
that they were merely following orders from the Wolf Gang and not actively participating in their evil deeds.
Jake divided Fidelia into sections according to their use and assigned each section to a local representative to
manage. Only the veteran General Nagano pointed out that leaving those who had done evil in the past with
the same group could cause problems in the future, but Jake did not follow his advice. At the time, Jake
believed the city should be governed by a collective effort rather than a single absolute. Doing so would be to
blame the current members of the city for what had happened under the previous regime, which would only
perpetuate the grudges of the past in the city. This was to create the ideal city-state he was aiming for, and at
the time, he assumed that others would be willing to share his ideals. However, his judgment proved to be a
rash mistake. He failed to be clear about what he was and wasn't willing to do as a ruler, and it didn't take long
for the consequences to become painful.
The rebellion of the delegates from the four regions was put down before long. This was due to the rapid deployment
of private soldiers that Melphine and General Nagano had reserved because of past crises in the city, as well as Jake's
quick recovery from the panic and the hiring of mercenaries from outside the city to mount a major counterattack.
Jake's proactive approach to halting the spread of the Red Plague was also a significant factor, as it solidified the
support of the citizens and prevented the contagion from spreading further. The rebellions in the four regions
were defeated and dispersed, and the ringleaders were arrested. Although the rebellions were quelled, Jake
was devastated, as his idealistic city plan was shaken to its core. He realized that his idea of an ideal community
where everyone can share their opinions and ideas was nothing more than a boy's dream in a bunker and that
a powerful force must be at the center of it to create an ideal society. Jake decided to become that force,
and he took the first step by publicly executing all of the rebellion's leaders.
While some considered his actions to be cruel, Jake pressed all opposition. He no longer hesitated, abolished the old system of
representatives, and reorganized all regions to be governed by a centralized government, with local officials at the center.
He placed himself at the center of this government as an uncontested supreme ruler. When the city spread out to the periphery,
covering some 500 square kilometers in all directions, he proclaimed himself the first Fidelian Empire emperor.
There were dissenters, but their voices were no longer heard in Fidelia. Realizing that unified discipline was the only way
to keep the community together, Jake chose to repress and control the voices of dissent to prevent them from spreading.
Fidelia was transformed from a small city into an empire, with Jake at the center of it all, an emperor, and a ruler overall.
Afterward, Jake no longer revealed himself to the people easily. Dwelling in the great tower he built in the
center of Fidelia; he preferred to keep his presence as invisible as possible, except on very few occasions,
such as official propaganda events. Only a select few, including his loyal and longtime subordinate Melphine,
had access to him. "The Emperor of the Empire must be perfect, strong, and superhuman." Jake's reign continued after
Fidelia was established and the country's foundations were laid, but his subjects knew little of him beyond his outward appearance.
He exists in a deliberate shroud of mystery and continues to rule the Empire today as a living, immortal Emperor.
